den Direktor des botan. Gartens zu Melbourne in Australien Dr Ferdinand von Mueller in Anerkennung seiner Verdienste um die Naturwissenschaft sowie der Württemb. wissenschaftl Sammlungen und Institute in den erblichen Freiherrn Stand gnädigst zu erheben geruht.

Ich habe den Frhrn von Mueller von dieser hchst Gnadenbezeugung benachrichtigt, und zugleich in der Zwischenzeit bezüglich des demselben in seinem Diplom zu ertheilende Wappens eine Korrespondenz gepflogen, in deren Folge der K. Wappencensor das in oben hier gehorsamst angeschlossenem Diplom abgebildete Wappen vorgeschlagen hat.

Nachdem Frhr v. Müller sein volles Einverständnis mit den Vorschlägen des K. Wappencensors mir mitgetheilt hat, habe ich nunmehr das Freiherrn Diplom für derselben fertigen lassen und erlaube mir solches E K M

p.seg: regarding the execution of the baronial diploma
for the Director of the Botanical Garden in Melbourne
Baron Ferd von Mueller

By virtue of the high decree of 6 July of last year, Your Majesty has graciously deigned to raise the Director of the Botanical Garden at Melbourne in Australia Dr Ferdinand von Mueller to the rank of hereditary baron in recognition of his services to natural science as well as to the scientific collections and institutes of Württemberg.

I have informed Baron von Mueller of this most gracious favour. Meanwhile at the same time, I have corresponded regarding the coat of arms to be granted to him in his diploma, as a result of which the Royal Herald of Arms has proposed the coat of arms depicted in the diploma most obediently attached here.

After Baron Müller has informed me of his full agreement with the proposals of the Royal Herald of Arms, I will have the baronial diploma prepared for him and take the liberty of respectfully submitting it to Your Royal Majesty with the most humble request that it be graciously executed.
